engine

Class Flow

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.Flow

  •  class Flow
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides implementations of the various algorithms dealing with flow in the Graph Toolkit, including Edmonds-Karp.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private Flow() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static Graph biDirectGraph(Graph g)
      Bidirects a graph (for every directed edge, adds the backwards edge).
      private static java.util.List<Edge> getEdgesFromNodes(Graph g, java.util.List<Node> nodes)
      Takes a list of nodes that forms a path, and creates a corresponding list of edges for that same path.
      (package private) static int getMaxFlow(Graph g, Node src, Node tgt)
      Implement the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm for finding maximum flow on a network.
      private static void mergeGraphs(Graph g1, Graph g2)
      Merges two graphs, g1 and g2, into g1

      • getMaxFlow

        static int getMaxFlow(Graph g,
             Node src,
             Node tgt)
        Implement the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm for finding maximum flow on a network.
        Parameters:
        g - The graph to find
        src - the starting node
        tgt - the ending node
        Returns:
        the maximum flow from src -> tgt on the graph g

      • biDirectGraph

        private static Graph biDirectGraph(Graph g)
        Bidirects a graph (for every directed edge, adds the backwards edge).
        Parameters:
        g - the graph
        Returns:
        a bidirected version of g
